required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Cognitive and Functional Status After COVID-19 Treatment at Danish ICUs
clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Cognitive and Functional Status After COVID-19 Treatment at Danish ICUs

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a prospective observational cohort study of 6 and 12 months long-term outcome of Danish speaking patients with COVID-19.

detailed_description.textblock: To describe frailty, cognitive function, functional status, fatigue, mortality and the quality of life 6 and 12 months after ICU admission of the COVID-19 patients enrolled in the Danish ICU COVID-19 database. Furthermore to investigate the association between ventilator days and Clinical Frailty Score (CFS) and the MiniMoCA, respectively at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission

primary_outcome.measure: The cognitive status at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission using the validated instrument MiniMoCA
primary_outcome.time_frame: at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
primary_outcome.description: The cognitive status at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission using the validated instrument MiniMoCA. Score 0-15, score above 11 indicate normal cognitive function. Two time points to see if there is a change in the cognitive status over time.

primary_outcome.measure: The functional status at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission using the validated instrument CFS
primary_outcome.time_frame: at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
primary_outcome.description: The functional status at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission using the validated instrument CFS (score 1-9) higher levels indicate more frailty. Two time points to see if there is a change in the frailty status over time.

secondary_outcome.measure: The association between ventilator days and CFS 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: The association between ventilator days and CFS 6 and 12 months after ICU admission. Will be one analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: The association between ventilator days and MiniMoCA 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: The association between ventilator days and MiniMoCA 6 and 12 months after ICU admission. Will be one analysis. But need to time points to see if there is a change.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mortality 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: Mortality 6 and 12 months after ICU admission. To see if there is a change i mortality at 6 and 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: EQ-5D-5L score 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D-5L score 6 and 12 months after ICU admission. Score 5-25. low score indicate better quality of life. Two time points to see if there is a change.

secondary_outcome.measure: Barthel ADL score 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: Barthel ADL score 6 and 12 months after ICU admission. Score 0-20, high score indicate high independence. Two time points to see if there is a change.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lawton-Brody IADL score 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: Lawton-Brody IADL score 6 and 12 months after ICU admission. score from 0-8 for female and 0-5 for male. High score indicate high independence. Two time points to see if there is a change.

secondary_outcome.measure: FAS score 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 6 and 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: FAS score 6 and 12 months after ICU admission. score from 10-50, high score indicate high level of fatigue. Two time points to see if there is a change.

study_pop.textblock: The study population is all Danish speaking COVID-19 patients, admitted and treated at one of the 29 Danish ICUs, and enrolled in the 'Danish ICU COVID-19 database' from March 10th and forward. Patients are 18 of age and above with a positive polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test for SARS-CoV-2 either prior to or during ICU admission

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- > 18 years
- enrolled in the 'Danish ICU COVID-19 database'
Exclusion Criteria:
- non danish speaking patients

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care
